docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 -- A thoroughly modernized basis for relations between the United States and Argentina, anticipating a pact to replace the outdated Treaty of Friendship, Commerce and Navigation of July 27, 1853, should be reached by the end of...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 -- A thoroughly modernized basis for relations between the United States and Argentina, anticipating a pact to replace the outdated Treaty of Friendship, Commerce and Navigation of July 27, 1853, should be reached by the end of this month, according to experts on both sides of the Joint Trade Commission, established last May.
docs.abstract: New basis for US relations seen in forthcoming trade accord

headline.main: NEW TRADE ACCORD WITH PERON CLOSER; Pact Would Supersede Treaty of 1853 and Put Emphasis on Economic Objectives

byline.original: By MILTON BRACKERSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, Nov. 2 -- Plans for a large-scale welfare program to assist millions of youngsters in ten Latin-American countries were approved today by the United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, Nov. 2 -- Plans for a large-scale welfare program to assist millions of youngsters in ten Latin-American countries were approved today by the United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund.
docs.abstract: ICEF votes large-scale program for 10 countries

headline.main: U.N. APPROVES HELP TO LATIN CHILDREN; Emergency Fund Provides for a Food and Medical Program for 10 American Nations

byline.original: By KATHLEEN TELTSCHSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 5 (AP) -- Argentina announced today that she would permit imports again for the first time since Sept. 17.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 5 (AP) -- Argentina announced today that she would permit imports again for the first time since Sept. 17.

docs.snippet: The Maria Moors Cabot awards, annually awarded by Columbia University "for the advancement of international friendship in the Americas," were announced yesterday.

docs.snippet: The United Nations has learned one crucial lesson in its efforts for world peace and that is "never to give up," Brig. Gen. Carlos P. Romulo, president of the United Nations General Assembly, declared yesterday. It was the spirit of this lesson, he...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United Nations has learned one crucial lesson in its efforts for world peace and that is "never to give up," Brig. Gen. Carlos P. Romulo, president of the United Nations General Assembly, declared yesterday. It was the spirit of this lesson, he said, that inspired the organization's peace efforts in Palestine and Indonesia.
docs.abstract: lauded by Dr B V A Roling

headline.main: ROMULO STRESSES ATOM BOMB CHECK; Control Is Biggest Problem Before U. N., He Says as 3 Get Columbia Awards

docs.snippet: CALIFORNIA is making ready for a busy season with a heavy schedule of fall and pre-winter events merging with the Christmas holiday weeks in a continuous stretch of merry-making. On Saturday, at El Cajon, a town inland from San Diego, a parade of...
docs.lead_paragraph: CALIFORNIA is making ready for a busy season with a heavy schedule of fall and pre-winter events merging with the Christmas holiday weeks in a continuous stretch of merry-making. On Saturday, at El Cajon, a town inland from San Diego, a parade of animated floats depicting Mother Goose characters will herald the pre-Christmas season.
docs.abstract: Colonial offers tours to Que skiing areas

headline.main: NEWS NOTES FROM THE FIELD OF TRAVEL

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 -- Representatives of the State Department have been in conference with Latin-American Governments concerning the possibility of concluding bilateral "investment treaties" to aid their economies, it was disclosed here today.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 -- Representatives of the State Department have been in conference with Latin-American Governments concerning the possibility of concluding bilateral "investment treaties" to aid their economies, it was disclosed here today.

headline.main: U. S. and Latin-American Nations Exploring 'Investment Treaties'; State Department Aide Says Aim Is to Help Their Economies -- Right to Withdraw and Convert Returns Held Imperative INVESTMENT PACTS SUBJECT OF TALKS
